instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2330: What is 820-2330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ethernet / not recognized
threads.message:
I´m working on the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board where ethernet is not recognized. When i plug the ethernet cable in it´s not showing ethernet (message: no ethernet cable plugged in)

any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ethernet / not recognized
threads.message: Measure between pin 1 and 2, 3 and 6, 4 and 5 of LAN connector for continuity. But who the hell uses LAN, I never bother to fix this crap.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ethernet / not recognized
threads.message: All lines checked. There is continuity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ethernet / not recognized
threads.message: Measure all pins the resistance to GND.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ethernet / not recognized
threads.message:
All Pins meassured and showing OL
​

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ethernet / not recognized
threads.message: That is all ok, I dunno, I doubt this is worth fixing. Could be a crappy connector verify the same measurements on the other end of a cable plugged in.
